name: Acropolis of Athens
description: An ancient citadel located on a rocky outcrop above the city, containing the remains of several ancient buildings of great architectural and historic significance, the most famous being the Parthenon.

name: Parthenon
description: A former temple on the Athenian Acropolis, Greece, dedicated to the goddess Athena, whom the people of Athens considered their patron.

name: New Acropolis Museum
description: An archaeological museum focused on the findings of the archaeological site of the Acropolis of Athens, housing more than 4,250 objects.

name: Syntagma Square
description: The central square of Athens. The square is named after the Constitution that King Otto was obliged to grant after a popular and military uprising on 3 September 1843.

name: National Library of Greece
description: The prestigious national library of Greece designed in a neoclassical style, part of the famous neoclassical trilogy of architectural landmarks.

name: Stavros Niarchos Foundation Cultural Center
description: A complex in the bay of Faliro in Athens which includes new facilities for the National Library of Greece and the Greek National Opera.

name: Athens Olympic Sports Complex
description: A sports complex built for the 2004 Olympic Games, hosting a variety of impressive venues such as the Olympic Stadium.

name: Technopolis (Gazi)
description: An industrial museum and a major cultural venue of the city, housed in the old Athens gasworks, which was founded in 1857.

name: Megaron, The Athens Concert Hall
description: A world-class concert hall known for its fine acoustics, hosting musical and theatrical performances as well as conferences.

name: Zappeion
description: A building in the National Gardens of Athens in the heart of Athens, Greece. It is generally used for meetings and ceremonies, both official and private.
